Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileDatabase

    public class Database
extends Object
    Represents an SQLite database file and its connection.
    Can perform common SQL operations using methods defined.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) Connection connection
      A connection to the database, which can be used to control it.
      (package private) boolean exists
      Flag for the existence of the database physical file.
      (package private) PreparedStatement preparedStatement
      Used to form a template for an SQL statement, then fill missing parameters, then be sent to the connection.
      (package private) Statement statement
      Used to send an SQL statement to the connection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Database()
      Passes a default file-name (database.db) to Database(String) .
      Database(String dbFileName)
      Creates an SQLite database file and connection.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> boolean batchInsertRecords(String table, T[][] array)
      Uses the 'INSERT' statement to add new rows into the database under the table passed.
      void createTable(String tableName, String[] columnsArray, String primaryKey, String[] foreignKeysArray)
      Creates a new table in the database, or makes sure the table is already created.
      void disconnect()
      Commits any pending operations, and closes the database connection.
      <T> boolean insertRecord(String table, T[] array)
      Uses the 'INSERT' statement to add a new row into the database under the table passed.
      boolean isConnected()
      Checks if the database connection is still up.
      String[][] viewRecord(String table, String[] columns, String condition)
      Uses 'SELECT' SQL statement to query the database for rows matching the criteria.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • connection

        Connection connection
        A connection to the database, which can be used to control it.

      • statement

        Statement statement
        Used to send an SQL statement to the connection.

      • preparedStatement

        PreparedStatement preparedStatement
        Used to form a template for an SQL statement, then fill missing parameters, then be sent to the connection.

      • exists

        boolean exists
        Flag for the existence of the database physical file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database(String dbFileName)
        Creates an SQLite database file and connection. Only creates a connection if the file already exists.
        It also sets auto-commit to false; so that communication becomes faster. Committing is done after each large operation is finished.
        Parameters:
        dbFileName - The desired physical file-name for the database.

      • Database

        public Database()
        Passes a default file-name (database.db) to Database(String) .

    • Method Detail

      • createTable

        public void createTable(String tableName,
               String[] columnsArray,
               String primaryKey,
               String[] foreignKeysArray)
        Creates a new table in the database, or makes sure the table is already created.
        Parameters:
        tableName - name of the table to be created.
        columnsArray - an array of the names of columns in the table in the form
        [column-name] [type]
        primaryKey - primary key column
        foreignKeysArray - an array of names of columns to be used as foreign keys, in the form
        ( [column-name] ) REFERENCES [table]( [column-name-there] )

      • insertRecord

        public <T> boolean insertRecord(String table,
                       T[] array)
        Uses the 'INSERT' statement to add a new row into the database under the table passed.
        This method passes only 'VARCHAR' to the database; for now.
        Parameters:
        table - The table the row is going to be added to.
        array - An array with column values at each index. MUST be in order of columns of the table.
        Returns:
        True if operation was successful.

      • batchInsertRecords

        public <T> boolean batchInsertRecords(String table,
                             T[][] array)
        Uses the 'INSERT' statement to add new rows into the database under the table passed.
        This method passes only 'VARCHAR' to the database; for now.
        Parameters:
        table - The table the rows are going to be added to.
        array - A 2D array of the column values to be passed. Each entry in the array is an array of values (row), IN-ORDER of columns.
        Returns:
        True if operation was successful.

      • viewRecord

        public String[][] viewRecord(String table,
                    String[] columns,
                    String condition)
        Uses 'SELECT' SQL statement to query the database for rows matching the criteria.
        Parameters:
        table - The table to search in.
        columns - An array of column names to search in. '*' can be used to search in all columns. Either '*' or a list of columns; not both.
        condition - An SQL formatted condition. Can be 'null'.
        Returns:
        A 2D array of rows. Each entry in the array is an array of values (row).

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Checks if the database connection is still up.
        Returns:
        true if the database connection is still up.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Commits any pending operations, and closes the database connection.
